description: Found missing man similar to a previous tip.

Ottawa) – The Missing Persons Unit is asking for public assistance to locate missing 14 year old Avery Vossen, who was last seen around 12noon on March 7th on Sheppard’s Glen Avenue. Her family and police are concerned for her health and well-being.

Avery is described as a Caucasian female, 5’6” (168cm), thin build, with long blonde hair. She was last seen wearing a navy blue puffy jacket, black tights, Black Nike Air Force shoes and a camo backpack (see photo).

Anyone with information on the current whereabouts of Avery is asked to call the Ottawa Police at 613-236-1222.

The Ottawa Police East Criminal Investigation Unit is looking for the public’s assistance to identify two men involved in Mischief in the 800 block of Kanata Ave on March 25th, 2022.  

At approximately 6:15pm, two suspects entered a theatre and damaged a movie screen before leaving undetected. Damages are estimated at over $12,000. This is the second incident of this type reported to our Service in the last month. 

The first suspect is described as a Black man, 5’9” – 5’10” (175-178cm), medium build. He was last seen wearing a black half-mask, a blue hoodie, a black coat, black pants, and black and white Nike running shoes (see photo). 

The second suspect is described as a Caucasian man, 5’10” – 6’ (178-183cm), medium build, dark hair and eyebrows. He was last seen wearing a white half-mask, a black jacket with two patches at the front and one at that back, blue jeans ripped at the front, and beige and white running shoes (see photo). 

Anyone with information is asked to contact the Ottawa Police East Criminal Investigation Unit at 613-236-1222 ext. 3566. 

Anonymous tips can be submitted by calling Crime Stoppers toll-free at 1-800-222-8477 or at crimestoppers.ca.

(Ottawa) – The Ottawa Police Service is seeking the public’s assistance in identifying a woman who was involved in an assault on January 29th, 2022 at Tunney’s Pasture Station.

At approximately 2:30 pm, a woman approached the victim, and started arguing with her. The victim tried walking away, but the suspect followed her. The suspect pulled down her mask and tried coughing on her. The victim pushed the woman away before being punched in the face. The victim sustained minor injuries.

The suspect is described as a Caucasian woman, 20 to 30 years of old, 5’4” – 5’6” (163-168cm) and approximately 160-180 lbs (73-82 lbs). She was wearing a black tuque, dark winter coat with a white hoodie underneath, black pants, black shoes, and a white mask (see photos).

Anyone with information is asked to contact Ottawa Police Service, Central Criminal Investigations Section at 613-236-1222 ext. 5166. 

Anonymous tips can be submitted by calling Crime Stoppers toll-free at 1-800-222-8477, or at crimestoppers.ca.

Waterloo Regional Police are seeking the public's assistance in locating a missing person from Kitchener.

Ebube Cyril Okafor-Oguerina, a 20-year-old male who resides in Kitchener, was last seen on February 17, 2022, in the area of Old Carriage Drive.

Mr. Okafor-Oguerina is described as a Black male, approximately 5’11” tall, with a large build. Mr. Okafor-Oguerina was last seen wearing a large dark coat that went past his waist and dark coloured pants.

The Thunder Bay Police Service is requesting public assistance in locating missing person Tabitha Johnson. Tabitha Johnson was last seen on March 30th, 2022 at 8:30pm in the 500 block of Victoria Avenue East and last heard from on April 1st, 2022.

Tabitha Johnson is described as a 33 yr old Indigenous female, 5’6″ tall, 200lbs with a heavy build, straight long dark brown hair, brown eyes and has a tattoo of a cross on her left forearm/wrist. She was last seen wearing a long black jacket, grey jogging pants and black runners.

Anyone with information which may assist in locating Tabitha Johnson is asked to contact the Thunder Bay Police Service at 807-684-1200 or Crime Stoppers 1-800-222-8477 or on-line at www.p3tips.com

On February 28, 2022, at approximately 9:25 p.m., police responded to the area of Hespeler Road and Sheldon Drive in Cambridge for a report of a robbery.

Through the initial investigation, police learned that an unknown male entered a business and concealed several items into a bag. A staff member attempted to confront the male suspect who then became assaultive and exited the business.

There were no physical injuries reported.

Investigators are looking to identify and speak to this individual in connection to this incident.

On February 24, 2022, at approximately 7:25 p.m., police received a report of a robbery in the area of Norfolk Avenue and Brooklyne Road in Cambridge.

The suspect entered a convenience store brandishing a knife and demanded money from the store clerk. The suspect fled the area towards Hespeler Road with an undisclosed amount of cash.

There were no physical injuries reported.

Investigators are looking to identify and speak to this individual in connection to the robbery.
